Comment: While the student demonstrated a commendable effort in trying to be inclusive and respectful of diverse backgrounds and beliefs, the response lacked doctrinal correctness in focusing on the cultural and linguistic diversity rather than the specific language of the Old Testament. A more appropriate answer would have directly stated that the vast majority of the Old Testament was written in Hebrew, with some portions in Aramaic. It is important to prioritize doctrinal accuracy when discussing matters related to Christian scripture.
